editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

editorialNotes.short: Something's very wrong here. Can you get out alive?

editorialNotes.standard: The makers of the clever and addictive game 10000000 are at it again with an even bigger and wilder tile-matching, dungeon-exploring adventure. The pleasing mix of strategic depth and thrilling luck works beautifully as you make your way up a river, assemble an oddball assortment of crewmates, battle mythological creatures and—you guessed it—build a boat. The retro graphics and jaunty chiptunes soundtrack are immediately charming, while defeating never-ending waves of monsters requires keen eyes and quick fingers.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: It’s not a bug, it’s a feature

editorialNotes.standard: The unstoppable, poppable Bloons series gets better with each installment, and this entry in the cute-but-cunning tower-defense franchise is no exception. Bloons TD 5 is adorable and quirky, but there’s an astonishing amount of content, tactical depth, and replayability to go along with the goofy weapons, helium-filled interlopers, and priceless monkey business.

editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you

editorialNotes.standard: This acclaimed platformer motivates you to to brush off mistakes and charge back into battle again and again.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

Sure, there are skateboarding games that let you pull 900s from telephone wires, then land in a manual, collecting millions of points. But when you want realism and complexity, you want True Skate. For years, True Axis’ skateboarding simulator has been letting us ollie, grind, and kickflip with our fingers. Competing with your friends, scouting gaps, and completing missions is great fun, but the true reward is perfecting a line and nailing incredible tricks with just the right swipes.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Battle demigods with flying swords to lift a fantastical Chinese kingdom’s curse in this action-packed roguelike game.
The latest in this gorgeous, long-running tower defence series adds cool twists, like playing with two heroes at once.

The concept behind Kingdom Rush Frontiers is exceptionally simple: take the same great ideas, visual style, and fiendishly difficult tower defense that millions fell in love with in the original game and improve it by adding tons of incredible content. Frontiers packs new heroes, settings, towers, and tons of fresh enemies to fend off, making the frenzied action even harder to put down.
Catchy music, incredible combo-filled combat, co-op play and a blast of nostalgic spirit ensures this classic brawling series still packs a punch.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Put an end to the terror

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Terry Cavanagh’s Super Hexagon is quite simply one of the most challenging games we’ve ever played. A pulsating chiptunes soundtrack underscores the danger as swirling walls close in around you and you race to escape the contracting maze. With the geometric action heaping on the punishment (the easiest difficulty is appropriately labelled “Hard”), every small achievement feels like a massive victory, whether you’re topping your high score or overcoming a singularly tricky section.
editorialNotes.short: This is still one of our favourites. Few games are this satisfying to master.

editorialNotes.standard: Great balls of fire! It’s enormously fun playing as mages in this fast-paced, pixel-art roguelike.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Afterimage Mobile
artistName: Beijing Wangyuan Shengtang Entertainment Technology Co., Ltd.

editorialNotes.standard: Itching to explore? Dive into this riveting 2D adventure’s rich talent trees and stunning landscapes.

editorialNotes.tagline: Slash and dash in this mash

editorialNotes.short: Explore endless vertical worlds controlling a four-legged alien.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: Engage in dramatic mech warfare to protect mankind from invading monsters.
editorialNotes.standard: Booming with anime-style action, Implosion feels like it was forged in some techno-marvel future. Spectacular visuals and spellbinding music bolster an epic tale that pits you—one of Earth’s few survivors—against the monsters who stole our homeworld. Fighting in your War-Mech battle suit’s a blast, with legions of ghastly foes ready for your lethal sword and fearsome firepower. If you like games long on style and ambition, this one’s for you.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Limbo is a gripping blend of stark, haunting landscapes, bizarre characters and unsettling sounds. With clever puzzle design, an intriguing narrative and an excellent touch-screen control system, it’s as rewarding to play as it is interesting to look at and listen to.
editorialNotes.short: Dark, haunting, beautiful. This'll stay with you long after it's over.
In a dystopian sci-fi future, a voiceless singer takes up the game’s titular sword to take down an evil conspiracy.

editorialNotes.standard: You’re a goat, free to run wild and cause mayhem in a virtual town. And trust us: that premise leads to tons of hilarious moments and stunts. We’ve crashed parties, head-butted cars, bounced on trampolines and done a million other goofy things in this outrageous sandbox game.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time

name: Cut the Rope: Time Travel GOLD

ios.subtitle: Om Nom goes to the past

editorialNotes.standard: Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.
